references.paper_title: Training a helpful and harmless assistant with reinforcement learning from human feedback
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the RLHF method used in SpeechAlign, providing the key framework for aligning LLMs to human preferences through reinforcement learning.

references.paper_title: Audiolm: a language modeling approach to audio generation
references.reason: This paper introduces AudioLM, a pioneering neural codec language model that leverages audio codecs for speech generation, directly influencing the architecture of the models used in SpeechAlign.
This paper presents EnCodec, a high-fidelity neural audio codec crucial to the success of neural codec language models and directly informs the choice of codec in SpeechAlign.

references.paper_title: Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback
references.reason: This paper details the RLHF method, which is a core component of SpeechAlign for aligning the speech language model to human preferences, providing the theoretical foundation for preference optimization.

references.paper_title: Neural codec language models are zero-shot text to speech synthesizers
references.reason: This paper introduces the use of neural codec language models for zero-shot text-to-speech synthesis, directly relevant to and foundational for the baseline system in the SpeechAlign model.
